content: Croft so I just started out with regular
white styrofoam packaging and it's a little over an inch thick and I cut it
into irregular shapes you know in descending size so I could stack them so
the smaller would be on top of the larger and I just used my hot wire foam
factories hands sculpting tool it's really nimble I like to use it it works
great on this kind of styrofoam and then I just glued it together with my hot
glue gun which is great because it doesn't get too hot some hot glue guns
get really hot and they'll melt the styrofoam so I like this particular one
the cc better because it doesn't now that I have these all glued together
this is where the magic happens right so we're gonna spray-paint these without
any protection and we're gonna get a really cool effect I'll show you that I
have my spray area all set up to catch the spray off here and I'll start
hitting these with the flat black spray paint and it's really gonna aggressively
attack these careful they fly around with the spray paint
you know pushes them around so hit put a lot of paint on them you wanted to be
aggressively attacked by the paint and I'm using the property that styrofoam
will melt with the spray paint as part of a project right usually you don't
want that you don't want your hard work melting but I'm gonna you actually use
that property in this project to make some really cool scatter terrain so just
want to hit the sides and you can see that aggressively attacking that
styrofoam it's really a cool effect and be careful you don't melt the whole
thing so there we go let's look at it when it's dry isn't that a really cool
look very unique I thought it'd be great for an alien world as well which I'm
using it for so let's hit the table and finish this up I then covered the whole
thing with matte Mod Podge and I added black paint to it like Jeremy a black
magic craft does and I want you just because I want you to be able to see the
sand the difference between the piece itself and the sand on it so as it's wet
I just drizzled the sand over it and put in this box to dry once all of that
dried I hit it with craft acrylic aqua color I wanted a really strange unusual
color for the alien planet and then I Drive brushed it with a burnt sienna so
I want to get a really neat effect so then what I did was I just washed it
with a black or a black and brown wash and will hit the table and I'll show you
the results of this and I think they came out really cool here's my desolate
alien world where I had my speeder race and I think the colors really looked
cool and alien right so here's the speeders I used I'll show this in a
later video that's worked out really great and these are to scale for the
game I did 15 millimeters so very fun but I thought these rock outcroppings
look great they looked really alien they don't look like your usual kind of rock
like this melted rock pitted Rock and I think it's just really a cool effect and
they're very solid actually with the Mod Podge and the sand on them right just
out of that styrofoam and I also hit him with this chocolate brown metallic which
was really give a really nice highlight on these so I hope you guys liked these
and I'll see you next time on the craft
